headline: SENIOR MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER | GENERATIVE AI & MLOPS ARCHITECT

experience_years_claims.evidence: Senior ML Engineer & AI Solutions Architect with 15+ years in software engineering and healthcare IT...
...including 8+ years building production ML and Generative AI systems.

experience.title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer & AI Solutions Architect
bullets: AI/ML lead for Medicaid integrity and care-management products (Program Intelligence, AuditStudio, ClaimsSure, Provider Risk Scoring, Patient Risk Scoring), owning architecture, implementation, and productionization of ML and GenAI capabilities.

Designed and deployed LLM-powered features on AWS Bedrock (RAG + vector search) to auto-generate human-readable fraud, provider risk, and patient risk narratives—reducing reviewer investigation time and improving coverage of high-impact cases.

Built agentic AI workflows (LangGraph + Bedrock) that orchestrate multi-step fraud pattern discovery, data retrieval, and explanation generation, uncovering emerging FWA schemes and risk patterns beyond static rules.

Engineered HIPAA-compliant ML pipelines on SageMaker & Glue (PySpark) processing 116M+ Medicaid claims annually with automated feature extraction, MLflow-based experiment tracking, and governed deployments to batch and real-time endpoints.

Operationalized supervised & unsupervised models for pre-pay and post-pay FWA detection, provider-level risk scoring, and patient-level risk stratification, integrating scores into SIU, audit, and care-management workflows.
Implemented monitoring for drift, bias, and performance using SageMaker Clarify and custom dashboards; defined SLOs and alerts to keep accuracy, latency, and coverage within target ranges.
Collaborated with product, engineering, clinical/care, and compliance teams to design robust APIs and data contracts exposing scores, risk tiers, and GenAI explanations to downstream systems.
Mentored engineers and analysts on GenAI, MLOps, Python best practices, and experimentation; influenced AI roadmap, standards, and governance.
Designed a patient risk scoring solution to identify high-risk Medicaid members needing timely outreach (e.g., avoidable admissions, disease progression, care gaps).
Engineered features from claims history, utilization patterns, chronic condition markers, demographics, and gaps in care to stratify members into actionable risk tiers.
Deployed on SageMaker with Glue-based feature pipelines and Redshift/S3 data marts, delivering ranked member lists and model explanations to state outreach and care-management teams.
Built a provider risk scoring engine aggregating claim-level, member-level, and peer-comparison features into unified risk scores for individual providers and groups.

Architected an analytics platform combining supervised models, unsupervised pattern mining, network analysis, and LLM-based narratives to detect fraud, waste, and abuse across large Medicaid populations.
Designed unsupervised ML pipelines using PCA and KMeans to score claims and providers for audit prioritization, increasing precision and scalability of post-pay audits.
Developed and deployed pre-pay fraud scoring models (logistic regression + scenario/rule-based logic) to flag high-risk claims prior to payment, increasing savings and reducing downstream audit load.

experience.title: Senior Associate Consultant (Software Engineer)
bullets: Developed and enhanced modules for Medicaid encounter processing and Open Health Plus using Java, PL/SQL, and SQL, with focus on correctness, maintainability, and clear separation of concerns.

Implemented backend services, stored procedures, and batch jobs to process high-volume healthcare claims and membership data, improving throughput and data quality for downstream reporting and compliance.
Refactored legacy code into cleaner, more modular components, reducing defect rates and enabling faster delivery of new business and regulatory requirements.
Collaborated with architects and business analysts to translate CMS/state regulations into technical designs, sequence diagrams, and data contracts.
Participated in code reviews, performance tuning, and deployment planning; worked with onshore/offshore teams using Git/SVN, Jenkins, and structured SDLC practices.

experience.title: Programmer Analyst (Software Engineer)
bullets: Built and maintained backend components for FedEx eDD and related enterprise systems, implementing business logic, data access layers, and integration points with internal services and external partners.
Developed REST/SOAP service integrations, validation logic, and transformation pipelines to support secure, reliable document and shipment workflows.
Created internal tools and utilities (Java/SQL and scripting) to automate recurring operational tasks, log analysis, and data reconciliation, reducing manual effort for operations teams.
Worked with architects and senior engineers to analyze production incidents, reproduce bugs, and deliver robust fixes with regression test coverage.
Followed engineering best practices—version control, branching strategies, peer reviews, and release checklists—to keep deployments predictable and low-risk.

experience.title: Programmer (Software Engineer)
bullets: Contributed to core modules of the HealthPAS Medicaid system, implementing business rules, data access logic, and batch processes in collaboration with senior developers.
Developed and optimized SQL/PL/SQL queries, procedures, and views to support transactional workflows, eligibility processing, and reporting needs.
Helped build integration components and utilities to move data between claims processing systems, credentialing tools, and downstream analytics/reporting layers.
Wrote unit and integration tests, assisted in test data setup, and fixed defects identified during system and UAT phases.
Collaborated with cross-functional teams (BA, QA, infrastructure) to debug environment-specific issues and improve system stability over successive releases.

education: Nizam College – B.Sc., Mathematics, Physics, Electronics | Sep 2003 – May 2007 | Hyderabad, India

certifications.name: Data Science and Machine Learning: Making Data-Driven Decisions
